rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description:
A TV actor is anyone (including people and credited animals) who has portrayed a character on a TV program, including minor appearances, like a cameo role. People performing in "non-character" roles on television programs, such as a "game show host" or a "news anchor" or a "sports announcer," should be typed using mso:tv.personality.
Things that are TV actors:
## Actors in starring TV roles (e.g. Hugh Laurie as Dr. Gregory House).
## Actors in guest TV roles (e.g. Rob Schneider in The Friars Club, the 128th episode of Seinfeld).
## Actors that have played a role in a segment (such as a sketch or short) that appeared as part of an episode of a television program (e.g. John Cleese in Dead Parrot).
## Voice actors (e.g. Kristen Bell, the voice of Gossip Girl).
## Animal actors (e.g. Moose, Orangey, Bamboo Harvester).
## Narrators of television programs (e.g. William Dozier, the narrator of the Batman television series).
## Actors appearing in a cameo role (e.g. Charlaine Harris in Beyond Here Lies Nothin', the 24th episode of True Blood).
Things that are NOT TV actors:
## Film actors (e.g. Ren??e Zellweger, Edward Norton, Gabourey Sidibe). Use mso:film.actor for these.
## People or credited animals who appear as themselves on a television program (e.g. Bill D. Moyers, Isabel Preysler, Max Weinberg). Use mso:tv.personality for these.
## Television characters (e.g. Jack Donaghy, Sookie Stackhouse). Use mso:tv.character for these.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: TV Actor
Guest Roles

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that links an actor to a television program on which the actor appears regularly.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Program

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates an actor to a segment (such as a sketch or short) in which the actor appeared as part of a full-length episode. It is also acceptable to simply enter the whole episode in the TV episode performances property instead.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: TV Segment Performances
rdf:Description.mso:type.property.deprecation_info: Use tv.actor.starring_roles or tv.actor.guest_roles instead. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles] Successor:[mso:tv.actor.starring_roles]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type collecting data on appearances on television programs, including the agent making the appearance and the broadcast content.

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: If this character appeared in a segment (such as a sketch or short) that appeared as part of a full-length episode, enter it here. It is also acceptable to simply enter the whole episode in the Appeared In TV Episodes property instead.

rdf:Description.mso:type.property.deprecation_info: Use tv.character.appeared_in_tv_episodes or tv.character.appeared_in_tv_program instead. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles] Successor:[mso:tv.character.appeared_in_tv_program]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description:
A distributor of television content. Historically, this was mainly through affiliate TV stations, which would serve specific geographical areas. However, with the rise of cable networks and, later, satellite TV, this historical definition no longer always applies. Now, a TV network may do any of the following: provide content to many geographically distributed affiliate stations (which may also provide their own programming), distribute content to smaller, partner networks, or broadcast the same content everywhere, bypassing the need for affiliate stations.
Things that are TV networks:
## Networks that distribute content to geographically distinct affiliate stations (e.g. Rede Globo distributes content to its member stations, such as Globo-RJ).
## Partner networks of the above (e.g. Oregon Public Broadcasting distributes content to its affiliate stations across Oregon, as well as content from the Public Broadcasting Service).
## Cable, terrestrial, or satellite networks that broadcast the same content across a wide geographic area. (e.g. Comedy Central).
Things that are NOT TV networks:
## Affiliate stations of any of the above (e.g.: Globo-RJ). In this case use mso:broadcast.tv_station.
## Cable or satellite TV providers (e.g.: MultiChoice, Time Warner Cable, Virgin Media Inc.). In this case use mso:engineering.cable_and_satellite_television_provider.
## TV Shows (e.g. Love to Love). Use mso:tv.program for these.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: TV Network

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Affiliates

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Areas Served

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: From

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Network

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the television program.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Program

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the airdate of the last episode broadcast on the given network.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: To

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description:
A type containing agents that appear as themselves on television programs. See the type tv.actor for agents that appear as characters other than themselves on television programs.
Things that are TV personalities:
## News anchors and reporters (e.g. Pia Arcangel, Charles Gibson, Vickram Bahl).
## Sportscasters (e.g. Linda Cohn, Jeff Stelling).
## TV program hosts (e.g. variety show host Don Francisco, game show host Clive Anderson).
## Talk show personalities (e.g. bandleader Kevin EuBanks,sidekick Andy Richter, weather person Al Roker).
## Reality show cast (e.g. Judge Simon Cowell, celebrity chef Gordon Ramsey, celebrity Khloe Kardashian, contestant Rob Mariano).
Things that are NOT TV personalities:
## Regular acting performances where a character is being portrayed (e.g. House's Hugh Laurie). Use mso:tv.actor in this case.
## Subject of a TV program (e.g. Billy Strayhorn: Lush Life). Use mso:media_common.subject in this case.
## TV characters (e.g. Carol Hathaway, Tony Soprano). Use mso:tv.character for these.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: TV Personality

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links a television personality to information about television episodes where he or she has made a guest appearance as himself/herself.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Guest Personal Appearance
TV Regular Appearances

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description:
A TV program is factual or fictional content that is broadcast on television. It may be a one-off broadcast or a TV series that has episodes. This type includes regular broadcasts (e.g. TV news), TV series or miniseries, television specials, made-for-TV movies and infomercials.
Things that are TV programs:
## TV series (e.g. Glee, Princess Hours, True Blood).
## TV miniseries (e.g. North and South, Band of Brothers).
## Reality TV shows (e.g. American Idol, The Hills, Operaci??n Triunfo).
## TV talk shows (e.g. The Oprah Winfrey Show, The Ellen DeGeneres Show, The Graham Kennedy Show).
## TV news programs (e.g. CNN Newsroom, Newsround, ABC World News).
## TV documentary films or series (e.g. Attenborough in Paradise, Day One, American Gangster).
## Television specials (e.g. Earth to America, A Muppet Family Christmas, Walt Disney World Christmas Day Parade).
## Made-for-TV movies. These should also be typed with mso:film.film.
## TV soap operas (e.g. As the World Turns, Mara Clara, Hollyoaks).
## Concerts aired on TV (e.g. Carpenters: Live at the BBC, A Concert for Hurricane Relief, United Nations Day Concert with Pablo Casals).
## TV game shows (e.g. The Price Is Right, Jeopardy!, Takeshi's Castle).
## TV coverage of sporting events (e.g. Red Bull X-Fighters, UFC 90: Silva vs. C??t??, The NBA on ABC).
## TV infomercials (e.g. Weekend Marketplace, Voices Across America: A National Town Hall).
## TV cartoons or animated programs (e.g. Simpsons, Naruto, Foster's Home for Imaginary Friends).
## TV show spin-offs, including international versions of TV shows (e.g. Who Wants to Be a Super Millionaire, Boston Legal, Canadian Idol).
Things that are NOT TV programs:
## TV seasons (e.g. Survivor: All-Stars, NCIS: Season 1, Saturday Night Live - Season 35). Use mso:tv.series_season for these.
## TV episodes (e.g. A Hard Day's Night, Through the Looking Glass, Chuck Versus the Ring). Use mso:tv.series_episode for these.
## TV specials that are episodes of a TV program (e.g. Extras: The Extra Special Series Finale). Use mso:tv.series_episode for these.
## TV episode segments (e.g. Dead Parrot, Bunny the Vampire Slayer, The Killings in Haditha). Use mso:tv.episode_segment for these.
## Multipart TV episodes (e.g. An Unearthly Child, The Best of Both Worlds, The Incident). Use mso:tv.series_episode in these cases.
## TV networks (e.g. ABC News, ABS-CBN, MTV). Use mso:tv.network in these cases.
## Films adapted from TV programs (e.g. Hannah Montana: The Movie, Bean, Charlie's Angels). Use mso:film.film and mso:media_common.adaptation for these.
## Video podcasts (e.g. CO-OP, CNN: Reliable Sources, The Totally Rad Show). Use mso:broadcast.content for these.
## Radio shows (e.g. The Adam Carolla Show, The Jack Benny Show, Lux Radio Theater). Use mso:radio.radio_program for these.
## TV commercials or advertisements (e.g. Aaron Burr (Got Milk?), Impossible Dream (Honda)).
## Music videos (e.g. Michael Jackson's Thriller, Eternal Flame, Coffee & TV). Use mso:music.music_video in these cases.
## Web series (e.g. Battlestar Galactica: The Resistance, Prom Queen and Lonelygirl15). Use mso:broadcast.content in these cases.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: TV Program

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a television program to an actor who appears regularly on the program.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Regular Actor
TV Show affiliation
rdf:Description.mso:type.property.deprecation_info: The intended meaning of this property is not clear. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a television program to the date on which the final episode of the program was first broadcast.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Air Date of Final Episode
rdf:Description.mso:type.property.deprecation_info: Use mso:tv.release.air_date_of_final_episode instead, since this information is relative to a particular market. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles] Successor:[mso:tv.release.air_date_of_final_episode]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a television program to the date on which the first episode of the program was initially broadcast.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Air Date of First Episode
rdf:Description.mso:type.property.deprecation_info: Use mso:tv.release.air_date_of_first_episode instead, since this information is relative to a particular market. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles] Successor:[mso:tv.release.air_date_of_first_episode]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a television program to awards that were won by the program.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: TV Show Awards

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a television program to a description of the camera used and/or its placement in filming the program.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Camera Setup

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a television program to a character that appears regularly on the program.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Character Entity

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a television program to the country where the program was produced.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Country of Origin

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: If this program is still being produced, select Yes. If it is no longer being produced, select No.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Currently in production

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a television program to a director of the program.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Director

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a television program to the length in minutes of the program (if it is not a series) or to the average length of an episode of the program in minutes without commercials.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Running Time

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a television program to the length in minutes of the program (if it is not a series), to the average length in minutes of an episode of the program in minutes or to the range in minutes of episodes of the series.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Episode Time

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a television program to a location where the program was filmed regularly (for specific episode and segment locations use the location properties on the corresponding types). This property should not be used for occasional "on location" filming or establishing shots.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Filming Location

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a television program to a genre of the program, e.g. drama.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Genre

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that links a television program to information about guest appearances of actors as characters on the program.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Guest Role

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a television program to a composer who created a score or background music for the program.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Incidental Music Composer

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property linking a television program to a language in which the program is available, either the original language of the program or a dubbed/subtitled language.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Languages

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a television program to the number of episodes making up the program.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Number of Episodes

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a television program to the number of seasons making up the program.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Number of Seasons

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property relating a television program to information about the networks on which the program is or was broadcast.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Network

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a television program to a network that broadcasts or has broadcasted the program.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Network

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a television program to the company (or one of the companies) that produces the program.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Production Company

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:tv.program to its mso:tv.program_creator(s).
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Program Creator

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a television program to a standard television rating, e.g. TV14, TVG, TVY, etc.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Rating

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Sequences of episode segments that have appeared on this program. Examples include "Saturday Night Live's long-running "Weekend Update" sketch and David Letterman's "Top Ten List". Note that the expected type of this property should be changed to tv.recurring_segment. Note too that the virtual property definition needs to be modified.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Recurring segments

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a television program to information about the actors who appear regularly on the program.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Regular Cast

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a television program to information about the personalities who appear as themselves on the program.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Regular Personal Appearances

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Review of this TV program
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Review

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a television program to one of the seasons of the program.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Seasons

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a television program to one of the episodes of the program. Note that this property should be used only to store episodes that are part of the regular seasons of the program. For special episodes, e.g. reunion shows or promotional shows, the property mso:tv.program.special_episode should be used.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Episodes

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a television program to the soundtrack for the program.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Soundtrack

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a television program to an episode that is not part of a regular season of the program, e.g. reunion shows or promotional shows. For episodes that are part of regular seasons, the property mso:tv.program.series_episode should be used.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Special Episode

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a television program to another television program that originated on the first one
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Spin-offs

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a television program to another program on which the first originated.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Spun off from

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a television program to one of the subjects of the program.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Subjects

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a television program to a synopsis of the program.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Synopsis

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a television program to the theme song for the program. Shows that have more than one theme song (or version of a theme song) can have more than one value entered here.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Theme Song

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a television program to information about the producers of the program.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: TV Producer

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links a television program to an action of watching the program on a personal device.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Watch Program

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a television program to one of the writers who worked on the program.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Writer

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description:
A person or company credited with conceiving the initial concept for a television program.
Things that are TV program creators:
## A person that creates a TV program (e.g. J.J. Abrams, Sydney Newman, Simon Fuller).
Things that are NOT TV program creators:
## A person who is a regular or recurring writer for a television program (e.g. David Fury). Use mso:tv.writer in this case.
## A person who produces a television program (e.g. Mark Burnett). Use mso:tv.producer in this case.
## A person who directs a television program (e.g. Rob Bailey). Use mso:tv.director in this case.
## A company that produces a TV program (e.g. BBC, Toei Animation, American Greetings, Stone Stanley Entertainment). In this case use mso:tv.production_company.
## Companies that produce films for theatrical release (e.g. Imagine Entertainment). In this case use mso:film.production_company.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: TV Program Creator

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Virtual property relating an mso:tv.program_creator to the mso:tv.program(s) the creator has credit for creating.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Programs Created
TV program guest
rdf:Description.mso:type.type.deprecation_info: Use tv.actor or tv.personality instead. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles] Successor:[mso:tv.personality]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type that collects information about a writer's tenure on a particular television program, viz. the time frame that he or she was a writer for the show.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: TV Program-Writer Relationship

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the last date that the writer worked on the show.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: End Date

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the television show on which the writer worked.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: TV Program

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the first date that the writer worked on the show.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Start Date

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the writer for the television program.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Writer
tv_episodes
rdf:Description.mso:type.property.deprecation_info: In terms of what this property is supposed to mean, it should be defined as a virtual property on tv.series_episode.rating. However, this would result in so many instances that the system would likely be overwhelmed. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A set of categories assigned to television programs to indicate the appropriate audience for the content.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: TV Rating System

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Relationship representing the collection of recurring segments of a TV program. For example, 'Weekend Update' is a recurring segment of Saturday Night Live, and 'Better Know a District' is a recurring segment of The Colbert Report.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Recurring Segment

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:tv.recurring_segment to one of its individual mso:tv.episode_segments. For example, "Better Know a District" is a recurring segment on the Colbert Report, and the 3rd congressional district representative, Brian Baird, interview would represent an episode segment of this recurring segment.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Segment

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a recurring segment to the television program of which the segment is a recurring part.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Program

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:tv.recurring_segment to the mso:tv.recurring_tv_appearance collecting the data about recurring character performances. For example, for the recurring segment of the Coneheads on SNL, John Belushi played Kuldroth.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Recurring Appearances

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:tv.recurring_segment to the type of the segment, e.g. 'live sketch' and 'video'.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Type

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Relationship type collecting the data on a recurring tv appearance. Recurring appearances are those in which the character played appears in some, but not most of the episodes. This is opposed to the regular cast, who appear in almost all of the episodes.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Recurring TV Appearance

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:tv.recurring_tv_appearance relationship to the mso:event.agent that made the recurring appearance.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Actor

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:tv.recurring_tv_appearance relationship to the mso:tv.character the agent played in the recurring appearances.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Character

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:tv.recurring_tv_appearance relationship to the agent's credit rank.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Credits Rank

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:tv.recurring_tv_appearance relationship to the mso:tv.series_episodes in which the agent appeared.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Episode

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:tv.recurring_tv_appearance relationship to the start date the agent started played the character.
Property relating an mso:tv.recurring_tv_appearance to the type of performance by the performer. Examples include 'host', 'him/herself'.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Performance Type

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:tv.recurring_tv_appearance relationship to the mso:tv.program in which the agent appeared.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: TV Program

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:tv.recurring_tv_appearance relationship to the mso:tv.series_season in which the agent appeared as the character.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Season

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:tv.recurring_tv_appearance relationship to the specific mso:tv.episode_segments in which the agent appeared.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Segment

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:tv.recurring_tv_appearance relationship to the last date the agent played the character.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: To

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type collecting information about a regular appearance of an agent as himself or herself on a piece of television content, whether a program or a season, episode or segment of a program.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Regular Personal Appearance

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property specifying the type of appearance or role that the agent has on the show, e.g. anchor, host or announcer.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Appearance Type

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the date that the agent began as a regular (as opposed to a guest) on the program.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: From

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the given agent.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Personality

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The seasons in which this person appeared on this show in a regularcapacity.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Seasons

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:tv.regular_personal_appearance to the specific mso:tv.episode_segment of a program in which the guest appeared.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Segment

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the last date that the agent appeared as a regular (as opposed to a guest) on the program.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: To

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Relationship collecting the data on a regular cast appearance for an entity. The properties included in this type are actor, character played, the program. This relationship is for regular cast, which means the actor appears in almost all of the episodes for a season.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: TV Regular Performance

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The actor playing this character.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Actor

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the character played by the actor as a regular (as opposed to guest) on the series.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Character

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the order in which the actor appeared in the credits when he or she appeared in the program as a regular cast member.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Credits Rank

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:tv.regular_tv_appearance to the individual mso:tv.series_episodes the mso:tv.actor appeared.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Episode

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the first episode in which the given actor portrayed the given character.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: First TV Appearance

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the airdate of the episode in which the actor first played the character on the show as a regular cast member.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: From

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the last episode in which the given actor portrayed the given character.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Last TV Appearance

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:tv.regular_tv_appearance to the specific mso:tv.episode_segment of a program in which the guest appeared.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Segment

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The seasons that the actor portrayed this character as a series regular (rather than in guest appearances).
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Seasons
Special performance type
rdf:Description.mso:type.property.deprecation_info: The intended meaning of this property is not clear. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the airdate of the episode in which the actor last played the character on the show as a regular cast member.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: To

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type that collects information about the distribution of broadcast content within a particular market.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Release

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the date when the final episode of the broadcast content aired in the given market.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Air Date of Final Episode

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the date when the first episode of the broadcast content aired in the given market.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Air Date of First Episode

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the market for the broadcast content.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Location
TV segment guest appearance
rdf:Description.mso:type.type.deprecation_info: Use mso:tv.guest_personal_appearance or mso:tv.guest_role, as this type will not be supported. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles] Successor:[mso:tv.guest_role]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The person appearing as a guest (that is, in a non-acting role and in a non-official capacity such as an interviewee or musical guest)
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Person
TV segment performance
rdf:Description.mso:type.type.deprecation_info: Use one of these instead: mso:tv.guest_personal_appearance, mso:tv.regular_personal_appearance, or mso:tv.regular_tv_appearance. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles] Successor:[mso:tv.regular_tv_appearance]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Special performance type
rdf:Description.mso:type.property.deprecation_info: The intended meaning of this property is unclear. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: TV segment personal appearance
rdf:Description.mso:type.type.deprecation_info: Use mso:tv.regular_personal_appearance or mso:tv.guest_personal_appearance, as this type will not be supported. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles] Successor:[mso:tv.regular_personal_appearance]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The type of appearance or \"role\" this person filled in this segment, such as \"anchor\", \"host\", or \"announcer\".
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Appearance type

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The person appearing in this segment. This person should be performing some official role in the segment -- host, interviewer, announcer, newsreader, etc.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Person

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type that collects information about who performed a given song on a given television episode segment.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: TV Segment Song Relationship

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the person or group that performed the music (live or pre-recorded) in the segment.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Performer

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the segment in which the music was played.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Segment

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:tv.segment_song_relationship to the mso:tv.series_episode in which the performance took place.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Episode

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the song or composition that was played during the segment.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Song

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The TV series that this sequence of segments was aired on.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: TV series

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all television episodes. Episodes are the self-contained parts of a particular serial mso:tv.program.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: TV Episode

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a television series episode to the date, if any, that the episode was first broadcast.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Original Air Date

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Virtual property relating an mso:tv.series_episode to the mso:tv.dance_episode_relationship that collects data on dance performance in this episode.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Dance Performance

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:tv.series_episode to its mso:tv.director(s)
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Director

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:tv.series_episode to the duration, or length, of the show.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Duration

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:tv.series_episode to the agent that edited the episode.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Editor

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a television series episode to the number of the episode within its season. Note that the related property mso:tv.series_episode.overall_number links a television series episode to the sequential number of the episode in the entire series.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Episode Number

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a television series episode to a location where the episode was filmed.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Filming Location

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a television series episode to information about personalities who made a guest appearance as themselves in the episode.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Guest Personal Appearances

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a television series episode to information about actors who made a guest appearance as a character in the episode.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Guest Stars

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:tv.series_episode to its host. Depending on the program, a show host may only introduce the next segment, or the host may take part in the show itself.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Host

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:tv.series_episode to the person providing narration for the episode.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Narrator

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:tv.series_episode to the mso:tv.series_episode that follows it.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Next Episode

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a television series episode to information about crewmembers involved in the production of the episode.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Crew

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a television series episode to the sequential number of the episode in the entire series. Note that the related property mso:tv.series_episode.episode_number links a television series episode to its sequential number within a given season.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Overall Number

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:tv.series_episode to the mso:tv.series_episode that precedes it.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Previous Episode

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a television series episode to information about producers involved with the production of the episode.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Producers

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a television series episode to the corresponding series.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Program

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a television series episode to another episode of the same program.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Program Episodes

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a television series episode to a network that broadcast the program corresponding to the episode.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Program Network

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The rating of this TV episode when it was originally broadcast.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Original Broadcast Rating

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Virtual property relating an mso:tv.series_episode to the mso:tv.recurring_tv_appearance relationship that collects data about the recurring cast for the episode.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Recurring Cast

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property relating a television series episode to its corresponding season.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Season

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a television series episode to another episode in the same season of the same program.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Season Episodes

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a television series episode to the number of the season to which the episode belongs.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Season Number

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property relating a television series episode to a segment making up the episode.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Segments

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a television series episode to information about a song performed in the episode.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Songs

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Virtual property relating an mso:tv.series_episode to the mso:tv.regular_tv_appearance that holds the data for the actors and roles for this episode.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Star

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a television series episode to a subject of the episode.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Subjects

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property linking a television series episode to a synopsis of the episode.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Synopsis

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Virtual property relating an mso:tv.series_episode to the mso:media_common.video_offer of the episode, either in whole or in part.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Video Offer

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:tv.series_episode to the mso:tv.writer(s) of this episode.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Writer

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all seasons for serialized mso:tv.programs. A season is a regular run of episodes that defines a self-contained part of the television program. A program often has more than one season, if picked up by a network.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: TV Season

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a television series season to an episode of the season.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Episodes

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:tv.series_season to the mso:location.location where the season was filmed.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Filming Location

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a television series season to the date of the first airing of the first episode of the season.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: From

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:tv.series_season to the tv.network that aired the season.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Network

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:tv.series_season to the following mso:tv.series_season.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Next Season

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property relating a television series season to the number of episodes in the season. Note that feature-length and multipart episodes should be included by counting the episodes as they were originally broadcast and not as they were syndicated.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Number of Episodes

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:tv.series_season to the previous mso:tv.series_season.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Previous Season

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property relating a television series season to the corresponding television program.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Program

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:tv.series_season to the rating the season has.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Rating

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a television series season to information about the actors and the characters that they play in the season.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Regular Cast

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a television series season to information about personalities who appear as themselves in the season.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Regular Personal Appearances

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a television series season to a number indicating the sequence of the season in the corresponding television program.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Season Number

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a television series season to a synopsis of the season.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Synopsis

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a television series season to the date of the first airing of the last episode of the season.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: To

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of performers that have been the host of SNL at least five times.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: SNL Five-Timer

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:tv.snl_five_timer to the role the performer had in the given episode of Saturday Night Live.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Type

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:tv.snl_five_timer to the five-timer's first appearance on SNL.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: First Appearance

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:tv.snl_five_timer to the mso:tv.series_episode that marks the five-timer's fifth time appearing on SNL.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Induction Episode

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:tv.snl_five_timer to the date of his or her most recent appearance on SNL.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Most Recent Appearance

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:tv.snl_five_timer to the total number of appearances the five-timer has had on SNL.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Appearances
TV song performer
rdf:Description.mso:type.type.deprecation_info: Use mso:music.artist or one of its subtypes instead. DeprecatedBy:[jcoop] Successor:[mso:music.artist]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all television soundtracks. Soundtracks are the recorded music that accompany the television program.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: TV soundtrack

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Television program that is the source of ths soundtrack.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: TV program
Special TV performance type
rdf:Description.mso:type.type.deprecation_info: The purpose of this type is unclear. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: episode_performances
rdf:Description.mso:type.property.deprecation_info: The purpose of this property is unclear. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: segment_performances
rdf:Description.mso:type.property.deprecation_info: The purpose of this property is unclear. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: starring_performances
rdf:Description.mso:type.property.deprecation_info: The purpose of this property is unclear. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all subjects in television shows.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: TV subject

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Segments of TV episodes that address this subject. Segments are stand-alone parts of an episode, such as a sketch in a comedy or anthology program, or a report in a newsmagazine, or an interview on a news or talk show.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: TV episode segments

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: TV programs that deal with this subject. Only series that address this subject generally should be entered; do not enter series that only address this subject in certain episodes. Examples might include, for the subject \"Medicine\" the program \"House\"; for the subject \"Time travel\", the program \"Doctor Who\".
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: TV programs

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Episodes of a TV program that address this subject.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: TV episodes

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all survivor contestants. These are the individuals who have appeared on the Survivor TV program as a contestant.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Survivor Contestant

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:tv.survivor_contestant to the mso:tv.series_episode in which the contestant gained immunity from elimination.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Immunity

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:tv.survivor_contestant to the mso:tv.series_episode in which the contestant was kidnapped by the opposing team.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Kidnapped

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:tv.survivor_contestant to the mso:tv.series_episode in which the contestant was exiled.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Exiled

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:tv.survivor_contestant to the mso:tv.survivor_season in which the contestant competed.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Season

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all Survivor seasons. These are the seasons of Survivor, the television show.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Survivors Season

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:tv.survivor_season to the number of days of gameplay.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Days

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:tv.survivor_season to the mso:tv.survivor_tribes that appeared in the season.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Tribes

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of Survivor tribes. Tribes are the groupings of contestants.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Survivor Tribe

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:tv.survivor_tribe to the mso:tv.series_episode that marks the end of the team's appearances in the season.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Ended

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:tv.survivor_tribe to the mso:tv.series_episode that marked the first appearance of the team in the season.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Start

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all Colbert Report episodes. The Colbert Report is a satirical mso:tv.program featuring the fictional anchorman Stephen Colbert.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: The Colbert Report Episode

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates an episode of The Colbert Report to the introductory text of the episode.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Introduction

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates an episode of The Colbert Report to the topic of the introductory text of the episode.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Introductory Topic

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates an episode of The Colbert Report to the featured word, whether real or not, of the episode, e.g. truthiness or jobsolete.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: The Word

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates an episode of The Colbert Report to the topic of the featured word of the episode.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: The Word Topic

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A musical composition that plays during the opening credits of a television program.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: TV Theme Song

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a television theme song to its corresponding program.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Theme Song for

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Sequences of episode segments that have appeared on this program. Examples include "Saturday Night Live's long-running "Weekend Update" sketch and David Letterman's "Top Ten List"
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Recurring segments
TV song
rdf:Description.mso:type.type.deprecation_info: Use mso:music.composition or one of its subtypes. DeprecatedBy:[jcoop] Successor:[mso:music.composition]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The length of this video in seconds.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Duration

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: When access to this video will cease.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Expires
rdf:Description.mso:type.property.deprecation_info: The intended meaning of this property is not clear. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The service upon which this video is hosted.

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The TV episode, film, etc. that this is a video of.

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The \"type\" of video this is (whether it's the full content, or just a clip, etc.)
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Video Type
rdf:Description.mso:type.property.deprecation_info: Use mso:media_common.video_offer.video_type instead, as this will not be supported. DeprecatedBy:[jcoop] Successor:[mso:media_common.video_offer.video_type]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The web address where this video can be seen.

Video host
rdf:Description.mso:type.type.deprecation_info: Use mso:media_common.video_source_enum, as this type will not be supported. DeprecatedBy:[jcoop] Successor:[mso:media_common.video_source_enum]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: videos
rdf:Description.mso:type.property.deprecation_info: The type of this property has been deprecated. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of video types. Types include segment and full content.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Video Type

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all television writers. These individuals are responsible for creating and shaping the story for an mso:tv.program.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: TV Writer

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Virtual property relating an mso:tv.writer to the mso:tv.series_episode(s) he or she has written.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Episodes Written

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property relating a television writer to information about the programs for which he or she has written.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: TV Programs

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property relating a television writer to information about the television program episode segments hich he or she has written.
